data.title: The Decalogue
data.meta_description: Cinema Classics DVDs with special pricing for libraries.
data.text:
The Decalogue (Complete Collection)

" There is not a moment when the characters talk about specific commandments or moral issues. Instead, they are absorbed in trying to deal

with real-life ethical challenges." - Roger Ebert

Considered by many critics to be one of the greatest movie achievements, Krzysztof Kieslowski's The Decalogue explores the timeless moral issues of human existence through ten contemporary tales, each based on one of the Ten Commandments. Originally produced for Polish television, this brilliant series of ten separate but subtly intertwining films transcended the boundaries of film and TV, winning honors in both arenas as it played around the world. The Decalogue won the FIPRESCI Award at the 1989 Venice Film Festival, was honored as Best Foreign Television Program by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts and was named Best Foreign Language Film by the Chicago Film Critics Association in 1997. Each episode was co-written by Kieslowski's longtime collaborator Krzysztof Piesiewicz and features music by Zbigniew Preisner. In Polish with English subtitles.

All ten films in a three-disc set.

Read more about each individual title:

Decalogue 1 Decalogue 6 Decalogue 2 Decalogue 7 Decalogue 3 Decalogue 8 Decalogue 4 Decalogue 9 Decalogue 5 Decalogue 10

DVD

Includes an introduction by film critic Roger Ebert

Available subtitles: English, Spanish

Three short documentaries about director Krzysztof Kieslowski: "On the Set of The Decalogue," "Kieslowski Meets the Press",and "Kieslowski Known and Unknown,"

A printed booklet with an introduction by Kieslowski, an interview with scriptwriter Krzysztof Piesiewicz and more.

Curator's Comments:

Read Roger Ebert's essay on this DVD Classic.

Director: Krzysztof Kieslowski

Color

10 films - total running time is 562 minutes

Released: 1988-89

Rated: NR

Country: Poland

Language: Polish (with English subtitles)

Genre: Drama
